intro: Triumfetta pilosa var. lejocarpa, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
